page.title: 14The Kinwarton Oak Trees
page.content:
Kinwarton has two oak trees which were planted for special occasions.
The Jubilee Oak was planted in 1887 by Captain Gerard for Queen Victoria's Golden Jubilee. Its circumference is now 2.44m or two armspans. Captain Gerard lived in Kinwarton House and he was very good to the poor. Tramps were given food by him and a road in Alcester was named after him.
In l953 the Great Alne and Kinwarton Coronation Committee planted an oak to commemorate the coronation of Queen Elizabeth II. It is now 0.98m in circumference. This is just under one armspan.
